description:
Drop in replacement of the `Radio`, `Switch` and `Checkbox` component.
Use this component if you want to display an extra label.

classes.description:
Override or extend the styles applied to the component.
See [CSS API](#css) below for more details.

control.description: A control element. For instance, it can be be a `Radio`, a `Switch` or a `Checkbox`.

disabled.description: If `true`, the control will be disabled.

inputRef.description: Pass a ref to the `input` element.

label.description: The text to be used in an enclosing label element.

onChange.description: Callback fired when the state is changed.

tags.title: param
tags.description:
The event source of the callback.
You can pull out the new checked state by accessing `event.target.checked` (boolean).
tags.name: event

name: FormControlLabel

descriptions.root: Styles applied to the root element.
descriptions.labelPlacementStart: Styles applied to the root element if `labelPlacement="start"`.
descriptions.labelPlacementTop: Styles applied to the root element if `labelPlacement="top"`.
descriptions.labelPlacementBottom: Styles applied to the root element if `labelPlacement="bottom"`.
descriptions.disabled: Pseudo-class applied to the root element if `disabled={true}`.
descriptions.label: Styles applied to the label's Typography component.
